definition: unable to reach a decision (idiom); cannot agree on the right choice/no unanimous decision/still a matter of discussion
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

sentences.english: It is showing no difference for basic concept of school mental - health education.
sentences.chinese: 中小學心理健康教育的基本概念衆說紛紜，莫衷一是。

sentences.english: But for cultural studies as a discipline remains understood that no agreement.
sentences.chinese: 但對文化研究作爲一個學科的理解仍然莫衷一是。

sentences.english: There are all kinds of explanations on it.
sentences.chinese: 歷來對它的解釋可謂是莫衷一是。

sentences.english: I was bewildered by the contradictory statements.
sentences.chinese: 我被互相矛盾的陳述搞得莫衷一是。

sentences.english: However, the method of taking drugs which is accepted by many athletes in doubtable.
sentences.chinese: 然而，仍有許多運動員對服用藥物這種方法莫衷一是。

sentences.english: But between exclusivity and compromise lie consensus and ambivalence .
sentences.chinese: 但衆口一詞與莫衷一是就存在於排他與妥協之間。

sentences.english: Art has been a product of modernization and modernity.
sentences.chinese: 對於現代主義的意涵，一直以來人們莫衷一是。

sentences.english: The origin of distillate liquor in ancient China is still an unsettled enigma for experts.
sentences.chinese: 我國古代蒸餾酒的起源，衆說紛雲，莫衷一是。

definition: (of a body of people) to offer all kinds of different opinions (idiom)/to argue endlessly
each sticks to his own opinion (idiom); chacun son gout
each sticks to his own view (idiom); a dialogue of the deaf
The benevolent sees benevolence, the wise sees wisdom./Different views are admissible. (idiom)
pinyin: ren2 zhe3 jian4 ren2 , zhi4 zhe3 jian4 zhi4

definition: what is true and what is fake
to mention sth without elaborating (idiom); not giving details
can't judge true or false (idiom); unable to distinguish the genuine from the fake/not to know whether to believe (what one reads in the news)
each sticks to his own view
